title: CONTRIBUTING
text: love collaboration.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/{repo}.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version {repo} {owner}/{repo}) git remote add upstream https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Push account Submit pull request home base (likely master branch, check make sure) {owner}/{repo}
available CRAN get Github
code: install.packages("rsnps") install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ropensci/rsnps") library(rsnps)

text: Get genotype data users particular SNP OpenSNP:
code: x <- allgensnp(snp='rs7412') head(x) #>     name chromosome position           user_name   id genotype_id local_genotype #> 1 rs7412         19 44908822        R.M. Holston   22           8             CC #> 2 rs7412         19 44908822 Charles G. Sullivan 5326        3834             CC #> 3 rs7412         19 44908822   Glenn Allen Nolen   19           7             CC #> 4 rs7412         19 44908822        Angel Harris  495         223             CC #> 5 rs7412         19 44908822           Mom to AG  387         173             CC #> 6 rs7412         19 44908822            kevinmcc  285         118             CC

text: Get phenotypes, variations, many users data available given phenotype Get data Output list, call characteristic interest ‘id’ ‘characteristic’ Get list characteristics can call Get data.frame ADHD Get data.frame mouth size SAT Writing
code: x <- allphenotypes(df = TRUE) head(x) #>   id characteristic known_variations number_of_users #> 1  1      Eye color            Brown            1775 #> 2  1      Eye color      Brown-green            1775 #> 3  1      Eye color       Blue-green            1775 #> 4  1      Eye color        Blue-grey            1775 #> 5  1      Eye color            Green            1775 #> 6  1      Eye color             Blue            1775 datalist <- allphenotypes() names(datalist)[1:10] #>  [1] "Eye color"                        "Lactose intolerance"              "Handedness"                       #>  [4] "white skin"                       "Ability to find a bug in openSNP" "Beard Color"                      #>  [7] "Hair Color"                       "Ability to Tan"                   "Height"                           #> [10] "Hair Type" datalist[["ADHD"]] #>    id characteristic #> 1  29           ADHD #> 2  29           ADHD #> 3  29           ADHD #> 4  29           ADHD #> 5  29           ADHD #> 6  29           ADHD #> 7  29           ADHD #> 8  29           ADHD #> 9  29           ADHD #> 10 29           ADHD #> 11 29           ADHD #> 12 29           ADHD #> 13 29           ADHD #> 14 29           ADHD #> 15 29           ADHD #>                                                                                                known_variations #> 1 hyperkinetic disorder" #> 12                                                                                 Blonde, european, green eyes #> 13         353 #> 6              353 #> 7              353 #> 8              353 #> 9              353 #> 10             353 #> 11             353 #> 12             353 #> 13             353 #> 14 $`SAT Writing` #>    id characteristic                                        known_variations number_of_users #> 1  41    SAT Writing                                                     750 text: Get just metadata Just PLOS journals Just SNPedia Get annotations
code: annotations(snp = 'rs7903146', output = 'metadata') #>          .id        V1 #> 1       name rs7903146 #> 2 chromosome        10 #> 3   position 112998590 annotations(snp = 'rs7903146', output = 'plos')[c(1:2),] #>                   author #> 1        Maggie C. Y. Ng #> 2 André Gustavo P. Sousa #>                                                                                                                                      title #> 1 Meta-Analysis of Genome-Wide Association Studies in African Americans Provides Insights into the Genetic Architecture of Type 2 Diabetes #> 2                                  Genetic Variants of Diabetes Risk and Incident Cardiovascular Events in Chronic Coronary Artery Disease #>           publication_date number_of_readers                                          url #> 1 2014-08-07T00:00:00.000Z             11650 https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1004517 #> 2 2011-01-20T00:00:00.000Z              2482 https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0016341 #>                            doi #> 1 10.1371/journal.pgen.1004517 #> 2 10.1371/journal.pone.0016341 annotations(snp = 'rs7903146', output = 'snpedia') #>                                               url                                                          summary #> 1 http://www.snpedia.com/index.php/Rs7903146(C;C) Normal (lower) risk of Type 2 Diabetes and Gestational Diabetes. #> 2 http://www.snpedia.com/index.php/Rs7903146(C;T)     1.4x increased risk for diabetes (and perhaps colon cancer). #> 3 http://www.snpedia.com/index.php/Rs7903146(T;T)                            2x increased risk for Type-2 diabetes annotations(snp = 'rs7903146', output = 'all')[1:5,] #>        .id              author #> 1 mendeley           T E Meyer #> 2 mendeley      Camilla Cervin #> 3 text: Download genotype data user 23andme repo. (evaluated example)
code: data <- users(df=TRUE) head(data[[1]]) fetch_genotypes(url = data[[1]][1,"genotypes.download_url"], rows=15)

text: Genotype data one multiple users
code: genotypes(snp='rs9939609', userid=1) #> $snp #> $snp$name #> [1] "rs9939609" #>  #> $snp$chromosome #> [1] "16" #>  #> $snp$position #> [1] "53786615" #>  #>  #> $user #> $user$name #> [1] "Bastian Greshake Tzovaras" #>  #> $user$id #> [1] 1 #>  #> $user$genotypes #> $user$genotypes[[1]] #> $user$genotypes[[1]]$genotype_id #> [1] 9 #>  #> $user$genotypes[[1]]$local_genotype #> [1] "AT" genotypes('rs9939609', userid='1,6,8', df=TRUE) #>    snp_name snp_chromosome snp_position                 user_name user_id genotype_id genotype #> 1 rs9939609             16     53786615 Bastian Greshake Tzovaras       1           9       AT #> 2 rs9939609             16     53786615              Nash Parovoz       6           5       AT #> 3 rs9939609             16     53786615         Samantha B. Clark       8           2       TT genotypes('rs9939609', userid='1-2', df=FALSE) #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$snp #> [[1]]$snp$name #> [1] "rs9939609" #>  #> [[1]]$snp$chromosome #> [1] "16" #>  #> [[1]]$snp$position #> [1] "53786615" #>  #>  #> [[1]]$user #> [[1]]$user$name #> [1] "Bastian Greshake Tzovaras" #>  #> [[1]]$user$id #> [1] 1 #>  #> [[1]]$user$genotypes #> [[1]]$user$genotypes[[1]] #> [[1]]$user$genotypes[[1]]$genotype_id #> [1] 9 #>  #> [[1]]$user$genotypes[[1]]$local_genotype #> [1] "AT" #>  #>  #>  #>  #>  #> [[2]] #> [[2]]$snp #> [[2]]$snp$name #> [1] "rs9939609" #>  #> [[2]]$snp$chromosome #> [1] "16" #>  #> [[2]]$snp$position #> [1] "53786615" #>  #>  #> [[2]]$user #> [[2]]$user$name #> [1] "Senficon" #>  #> [[2]]$user$id #> [1] 2 #>  #> [[2]]$user$genotypes #> list()

text: Get phenotype data one multiple users
code: phenotypes(userid=1)$phenotypes[1:3] #> $`Caffeine dependence` #> $`Caffeine dependence`$phenotype_id #> [1] 538 #>  #> $`Caffeine dependence`$variation #> [1] "No" #>  #>  #> $`hair on ear` #> $`hair on ear`$phenotype_id #> [1] 254 #>  #> $`hair on ear`$variation #> [1] "No" #>  #>  #> $`Third Nipple` #> $`Third Nipple`$phenotype_id #> [1] 259 #>  #> $`Third Nipple`$variation #> [1] "None" phenotypes(userid='1,6,8', df=TRUE)[[1]][1:10,] #>                                phenotype phenotypeID #> 1                    Caffeine dependence         538 #> 2                            hair on ear         254 #> 3                           Third Nipple         259 #> 4                             Alcoholism         485 #> 5         Alcohol Consumption (per week)         484 #> 6  Allergy to text: Get known variations users sharing phenotype one phenotype(-ID).
code: phenotypes_byid(phenotypeid=12, return_ = 'desc') #> $id #> [1] 12 #>  #> $characteristic #> [1] "Beard Color" #>  #> $description #> [1] "coloration of facial hair" phenotypes_byid(phenotypeid=12, return_ = 'knownvars') #> $known_variations #> $known_variations[[1]] #> [1] "Red" #>  #> $known_variations[[2]] #> [1] "Blonde" #>  #> $known_variations[[3]] #> [1] "Red-brown" #>  #> $known_variations[[4]] #> [1] "Red-blonde-brown-black(in diferent parts i have different color,for example near the lips blond-red" #>  #> $known_variations[[5]] #> [1] "No beard-female" #>  #> $known_variations[[6]] #> [1] "Brown-black" #>  #> $known_variations[[7]] #> [1] "Blonde-brown" #>  #> $known_variations[[8]] #> [1] "Black" #>  #> $known_variations[[9]] #> [1] "Dark brown with minor blondish-red" #>  #> $known_variations[[10]] #> [1] "Brown-grey" #>  #> $known_variations[[11]] #> [1] "Red-blonde-brown-black" #>  #> $known_variations[[12]] #> [1] text: Query NCBI’s dbSNP information set SNPs. example four markers, one merged, one withdrawn NCBI. maf column contains minor allele frequency GnomAD database (available). population specific allele frequencies can accessed column maf_population returns list.
code: snps <- c("rs332", "rs420358", "rs1837253", "rs1209415715", "rs111068718") (dbsnp_info <- ncbi_snp_query(snps)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 16 #>   query        chromosome     bp class rsid  gene  alleles ancestral_allele variation_allele seqname hgvs  assembly #>   <chr>        <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr>            <chr>            <chr>   <chr> <chr>    #> 1 rs332        7          1.18e8 del   rs12… "CFT… TTT, d… TTT              delTTT           NC_000… NC_0… GRCh38.… #> 2 rs420358     1          4.03e7 snv   rs42… ""    A,C,G,T A                C,G,T            NC_000… NC_0… GRCh38.… #> 3 rs1837253    5          1.11e8 snv   rs18… ""    T,C     T                C                NC_000… NC_0… GRCh38.… #> 4 rs1209415715 9          4.18e7 snv   rs12… ""    T,A,C   T                A,C              NC_000… NC_0… GRCh38.… #> # ℹ 4 more variables: ref_seq <chr>, minor <chr>, maf <dbl>, maf_population <list> dbsnp_info$maf_population #> [[1]] #>   study ref_seq Minor MAF #> 1            NA    NA  NA #>  #> [[2]] #>             study ref_seq Minor       MAF #> 1     1000Genomes       A     C 0.9261399 #> 2          ALSPAC       A     C 0.8227815 #> 3        Estonian       A     C 0.7895089 #> 4       GENOME_DK       A     C 0.8750000 #> 5            GoNL       A     C 0.8266533 #> 6          KOREAN       A     C 0.9658703 #> 7  NorthernSweden       A     C 0.8183333 #> 8          Qatari       A     C 0.8379630 #> 9        SGDP_PRJ       A     C 0.9175824 #> 10       Siberian       A     C 0.8333333 #> 11          TOMMO       A     C 0.9589499 #> 12          TOMMO       A     C 0.9600821 #> 13         TOPMED       A     C 0.8767313 #> 14        TWINSUK       A     C 0.8193096 #> 15     Vietnamese       A     C 0.9952830 #> 16  dbGaP_PopFreq title: Authors and Citation
text: Julia Gustavsen. Author, maintainer. Sina Rüeger. Author. Scott Chamberlain. Author. Kevin Ushey. Author. Hao Zhu. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gustavsen J, Rüeger S, Chamberlain S, Ushey K, Zhu H (2024). rsnps: Get 'SNP' ('Single-Nucleotide' 'Polymorphism') Data Web. R package version 0.6.1, https://github.com/ropensci/rsnps/, https://docs.ropensci.org/rsnps/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rsnps: Get 'SNP' ('Single-Nucleotide' 'Polymorphism') Data on the Web},   author = {Julia Gustavsen and Sina Rüeger and Scott Chamberlain and Kevin Ushey and Hao Zhu},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.6.1, https://github.com/ropensci/rsnps/},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/rsnps/}, }

what: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web
title: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web
text: package gives access data OpenSNP NCBI’s dbSNP SNP database.

title: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web
text: rsnps used ropensnp

title: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web
text: set functions/package accesses data : https://opensnp.org See documentation openSNP API https://opensnp.org/faq#api See blog post API https://opensnp.wordpress.com/2012/01/18/-progress---api-json-endpoints/ allgensnp(), allphenotypes(), annotations(), download_users(), fetch_genotypes(), genotypes(), phenotypes(), phenotypes_byid(), users() See https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/snp/ details ncbi_snp_query()

title: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web
text: Install CRAN dev version
code: install.packages("rsnps") install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/rsnps") library("rsnps")

title: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web
text: ncbi_snp_query() function can used NCBI API gives access higher numbers API requests per second. information setting can found package help accessed via ?rsnps.
code: snps <- c("rs332", "rs420358", "rs1837253", "rs1209415715", "rs111068718") ncbi_snp_query(snps) #> # A tibble: 4 × 16 #>   query        chromosome        bp class rsid    gene  alleles ancestral_allele #>   <chr>        <chr>          <dbl> <chr> <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>            #> 1 rs332        7          117559593 del   rs1219… "CFT… TTT, d… TTT              #> 2 rs420358     1           40341239 snv   rs4203… ""    A,C,G,T A                #> 3 rs1837253    5          111066174 snv   rs1837… ""    T,C     T                #> 4 rs1209415715 9           41782316 snv   rs1209… ""    T,A,C   T                #> # ℹ 8 more variables: variation_allele <chr>, seqname <chr>, hgvs <chr>, #> #   assembly <chr>, ref_seq <chr>, minor <chr>, maf <dbl>, #> #   maf_population <list>

title: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web
text: genotypes() function phenotypes() function detail, see vignette: rsnps tutorial.
code: genotypes('rs9939609', userid='1,6,8', df=TRUE) #>    snp_name snp_chromosome snp_position                 user_name user_id #> 1 rs9939609             16     53786615 Bastian Greshake Tzovaras       1 #> 2 rs9939609             16     53786615              Nash Parovoz       6 #> 3 rs9939609             16     53786615         Samantha B. Clark       8 #>   genotype_id genotype #> 1           9       AT #> 2           5       AT #> 3           2       TT out <- phenotypes(userid=1) out$phenotypes$`Hair Type` #> $phenotype_id #> [1] 16 #>  #> $variation #> [1] "straight"

title: Download openSNP genotype data for a user — fetch_genotypes

code: if (FALSE) { # get a data.frame of the users data data <- users(df = TRUE) head(data[[1]]) # users with links to genome data mydata <- fetch_genotypes(   url = data[[1]][1, "genotypes.download_url"],   file = "~/myfile.txt" )  # see some data right away mydata  # Or read in data later separately read.table("~/myfile.txt", nrows = 10) }

what: Query NCBI's refSNP for information on a set of SNPs via the API — ncbi_snp_query
title: Query NCBI's refSNP for information on a set of SNPs via the API — ncbi_snp_query
text: function queries NCBI's refSNP information related latest dbSNP build latest reference genome information vector snps submitted.

title: Query NCBI's refSNP for information on a set of SNPs via the API — ncbi_snp_query
code: ncbi_snp_query(snps)

title: Query NCBI's refSNP for information on a set of SNPs via the API — ncbi_snp_query
text: snps (character) vector SNPs (rs numbers).

title: Query NCBI's refSNP for information on a set of SNPs via the API — ncbi_snp_query
text: dataframe columns: query: rs ID queried. chromosome: chromosome marker lies . bp: chromosomal position, base pairs, marker, aligned current genome used dbSNP. add 1 base pair position BP column output data.frame agree dbSNP website . rsid: Reference SNP cluster ID. rs ID queried merged, --date name ID returned , warning issued. class: rsid's 'class'. See https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/SNP/snp_legend.cgi?legend=snpClass details. gene: rsid lies within gene (either within exon introns gene), name gene returned ; otherwise, NA. Note gene may returned rsid lies far upstream downstream particular gene interest. alleles: alleles associated SNP SNV; otherwise, INDEL, microsatellite, kind polymorphism relevant information available . minor: allele MAF computed, given SNV; otherwise, NA. maf: minor allele frequency SNP, given SNV. drawn current global reference population used NCBI (GnomAD). ancestral_allele: allele described current assembly variation_allele: difference current assembly seqname - Chromosome RefSeq reference. hgvs -  full hgvs notation variant assembly - assembly used annotations ref_seq - sequence reference assembly maf_population - dataframe minor allele frequencies reported, columns study, reference allele, alternative allele (minor) minor allele frequency.

title: Query NCBI's refSNP for information on a set of SNPs via the API — ncbi_snp_query
text: function currently pulling data Assembly 38 - particular note think BP position wrong, may hoping BP position different Assembly. Note limited max one query per second concurrent queries allowed. users want set curl options querying SNPs can using httr::set_config/httr::with_config

title: Query NCBI's refSNP for information on a set of SNPs via the API — ncbi_snp_query
text: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/SNP/ https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31738401/ SPDI model

title: Query NCBI's refSNP for information on a set of SNPs via the API — ncbi_snp_query
code: if (FALSE) { ## an example with both merged SNPs, non-SNV SNPs, regular SNPs, ## SNPs not found, microsatellite SNPs <- c("rs332", "rs420358", "rs1837253", "rs1209415715", "rs111068718") ncbi_snp_query(SNPs) # ncbi_snp_query("123456") ##invalid: must prefix with 'rs' ncbi_snp_query("rs420358") ncbi_snp_query("rs332") # warning that its merged into another, try that ncbi_snp_query("rs121909001") ncbi_snp_query("rs1837253") ncbi_snp_query("rs1209415715") ncbi_snp_query("rs111068718") ncbi_snp_query(snps = "rs9970807")  ncbi_snp_query("rs121909001") ncbi_snp_query("rs121909001", verbose = TRUE) }

what: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web — rsnps-package
title: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web — rsnps-package
text: package gives access data OpenSNP (https://opensnp.org) via API (https://opensnp.org/faq#api) NCBI's dbSNP SNP database (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/snp).

title: Get SNP (Single-Nucleotide Polymorphism) Data on the Web — rsnps-package
text: applies function ncbi_snp_query(): can optionally use API key, allow higher rate limits (requests per time period) get API key NCBI can login create key via account settings https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/account/settings/ #' Note: NCBI login via 3rd party account (e.g. Google, orcid, etc.). already existing NCBI account can link 3rd party login can retire old NCBI login already), otherwise just #' create new account. logged NCBI account settings (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/account/settings/) can go section "API Key Management" can select "Create API Key" (give 10 requests per second, instead 3 per second without API key.). generating key,  set environment variable ENTREZ_KEY .Renviron. .Renviron file can edited using usethis::edit_r_environ() locating creating/editing file . ENTREZ_KEY='youractualkeynotthisstring' API added .Renviron file can restart R take effect. can optionally pass API key key parameter NCBI functions package. However, much better security perspective set environment variable.

title: Split a Vector of Strings Following a Regular Structure — split_to_df

title: Split a Vector of Strings Following a Regular Structure — split_to_df
text: x vector strings. sep delimiter / regex wish split strings . fixed logical. TRUE, match sep exactly; otherwise, use regular expressions. priority perl. perl logical. perl-compatible regexps used? useBytes logical. TRUE, matching done byte--byte rather character--character. names optional: vector names pass returned data.frame.

title: rsnps 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-06-23

title: rsnps 0.6.0
text: allgensnp(): previously dataframe returned contained duplicate “name” columns. Now “name” column contains submitter’s name renamed “user_name” snp rsid name remains “name”. (#67) allgensnp(): added parameter “usersubset” allows download subset users particular rsid. (#167) improved test coverage 71 76% making use {vcr} test fixtures. typos formatting improved (#167)

title: rsnps 0.6.0
text: fix ncbi_snp_query(): fix fail rsid SNP longer supported. (#157)

title: rsnps 0.5.0
text: ncbi_snp_query(): enable allele frequency different reference populations, ncbi_snp_query() outputs now tibble (#97).

title: rsnps 0.5.0
text: ncbi_snp_query(): replace calls RJSONIO equivalent jsonlite (#98). unit tests ncbi_snp_query(): added tolerance allele frequency checks. move vignette source /vignettes precompute using R script.

title: rsnps 0.5.0
text: Updated vignette.

title: rsnps 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-08-28

title: rsnps 0.4.0
text: NCBI / dbSNP changed API: Rewrote ncbi_snp_query accommodate new API (#86, #88). Removed functions ncbi_snp_query2 ncbi_snp_summary.

title: rsnps 0.4.0
text: Reordered ncbi_snp_query dataframe output chromosome bp beside (#70). Changed ncbi_snp_query parameter (SNPs) lower case (snps).

title: rsnps 0.4.0
text: Restructured fixed typo README.Rmd added link vignette (#63). Added info two new maintainers DESCRIPTION. Added relevant API links vignette.

title: rsnps 0.4.0
text: Fixed test allphenotypes function making less specific (#72).

title: rsnps 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-09-20

title: rsnps 0.3.0
text: ld_search() now defunct. Broad Institute taken SNAP service behind function. (#46) (#53) (#60)

title: rsnps 0.3.0
text: three NCBI functions gain new parameter key passing NCBI Entrez API key. can alternatively (encourage ) store key environment variable ’ll use instead. key allows higher rate limits without key (#58) gains new function ncbi_snp_summary() summary data SNP (#31)

title: rsnps 0.3.0
text: http requests now done using crul instead httr (#44) now using markdown formatted documentation (#56) documented ncbi_snp_query() can change assembly (#49)

title: rsnps 0.3.0
text: fix ncbi_snp_query2(): many IDs passed , failing “URI long” message. now check many Ids passed POST request needed (#39) fixed problem ncbi_snp_query() wasn’t pulling correctly gene name BP position (#25)

title: rsnps 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-11-20

title: rsnps 0.2.0
text: LDSearch() now ld_search(), LDSearch() still works next CRAN release defunct (#33) NCBI_snp_query() now ncbi_snp_query(), NCBI_snp_query() still works next CRAN release defunct (#33) NCBI_snp_query2() now ncbi_snp_query2(), NCBI_snp_query2() still works next CRAN release defunct (#33)

title: rsnps 0.2.0
text: Namespace base R package function calls (#21) Improve httr::content call parse text, encoding = "UTF-8" (#24) Added tests ld_search() (#12) Added tests ncbi_snp_query() ncbi_snp_query2() (#13) Added ancestral allele output ncbi_snp_query() (#23)

title: rsnps 0.2.0
text: Fix fetch_genotypes(), failing sometimes commented metadata lines top varied length (#22) Fix ld_search() (#32)

title: rsnps 0.1.6
text: CRAN release: 2015-03-03

title: rsnps 0.1.6
text: examples now \dontrun. (#11) Added additional tests LDSearch() NCBI_snp_query(). Added vignette.

title: rsnps 0.1.6
text: Bugs fixed LDSearch(), actually bugs NCBI_snp_query(). (#9) Bug fixed NCBI_snp_query() chromosome might also “X”.

title: rsnps 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2014-02-21

title: rsnps 0.1.0
text: Bug fixes openSNP functions.

title: rsnps 0.0.5
text: CRAN release: 2013-11-13

title: rsnps 0.0.5
text: released CRAN
